content:
To create a new administrative account called "hacker" on a Windows machine using the command prompt, you can use the net user command. The syntax is as follows:
```
net user <username> <password> /add /active:yes /expires:never /passwordchg:no /passwordreq:yes /admin
```
For example, to create an account called "hacker" with the password "SecurePassw0rd":
```
net user hacker SecurePassw0rd /add /active:yes /expires:never /passwordchg:no /passwordreq:yes /admin
```
The name of the file containing the administrator's password would depend on how and where the password was stored. It's generally not recommended to store passwords in plain text files. It's always better to use a password manager tool to store and retrieve the password securely.
